paragraphs.text:
%md
# In-Memory Lab for DBCS

This Zeppelin notebook contains some runnable exercises to test the In-Memory option.

Run this notebook one paragraph at a time from top to bottom.

This is a work-in-progress.  More verbose documentation will come later.

Documentation for Oracle In memory features can be found here: https://docs.oracle.com/database/122/INMEM/toc.htm.  

Please direct comments to: Ram Posham () /Sadhana avasarala (sadhana.avasarala@oracle.com)

paragraphs.title: Unlock the scott account in the PDB.  (not needed for the lab)
paragraphs.text:
%sh
cat <<EOF > /tmp/sql1.sql
set echo on
set pages 999
set timing on
ALTER SESSION SET container = PDB1;
SHOW CON_NAME
alter user scott identified by tiger account unlock;
exit;
EOF

sqlplus / as sysdba @/tmp/sql1.sql

paragraphs.title: Script to setup a zeppelin jdbc connection for the Scott user
paragraphs.text:
%sh
echo "Script to set some zeppelin jdbc parameters"

echo "Set the User, Password, and ConnectString parameters in the script as appropriate"
User=scott
Password=tiger
ConnectString="localhost:1521/PDB1.gse00002281.oraclecloud.internal"
echo $ConnectString

cat <<EOF > /tmp/jdbc_settings.py
#!/usr/local/bin/python
#based on https://community.hortonworks.com/articles/36031/sample-code-to-automate-interacting-with-zeppelin.html by Ali Bajwa
def post_request(url, body):
  import json, urllib2
  encoded_body = json.dumps(body)
  req = urllib2.Request(str(url), encoded_body)
  req.get_method = lambda: 'PUT'
  try:
    response = urllib2.urlopen(req, encoded_body).read()
  except urllib2.HTTPError, error:
    print 'Exception: ' + error.read()
  jsonresp = json.loads(response.decode('utf-8'))
  print jsonresp['status']
        
 
 
import json, urllib2
zeppelin_int_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:9090/api/interpreter/setting/'
data = json.load(urllib2.urlopen(zeppelin_int_url))
for body in data['body']:
  if body['group'] == 'jdbc':
    jdbcbody = body
  elif body['group'] == 'spark':
    sparkbody = body    
    

 
jdbcbody['properties']['orcl-scott.driver'] = 'oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver'
jdbcbody['properties']['orcl-scott.user'] = '$User'
#jdbcbody['properties']['orcl-scott.password'] = '$Password'  
#Zeppelin seems to be setting password to null, so leave it out
#so for now, put the password in the connect string
jdbcbody['properties']['orcl-scott.url'] = 'jdbc:oracle:thin:$User/$Password@//$ConnectString'


my_dict = {'groupArtifactVersion':  '/u01/app/oracle/product/12.1.0/dbhome_1/jdbc/lib/ojdbc7.jar',       'local': False}
jdbcbody['dependencies'].append(my_dict)
post_request(zeppelin_int_url + jdbcbody['id'], jdbcbody)
EOF
#cat /tmp/jdbc_settings.py
echo ".."
python /tmp/jdbc_settings.py
echo "done"

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Lab starts here

In this lab, you learn about "In memory" options in Oracle Database how to use them. 


Oracle Database In-Memory is designed for mixed workloads. Its unique dual-format approach accelerates analytics while ensuring that the most up-to-date transactional data is constantly available—no moving of data out to a separate database.


//TO DO add more description

Documentation for Oracle In memory features can be found here: https://docs.oracle.com/database/122/INMEM/toc.htm.  

Please direct comments to: Ram Posham () /Sadhana avasarala (sadhana.avasarala@oracle.com)

paragraphs.title: Create JDBC connection for ssb user
paragraphs.text:
%sh
echo "Script to set some zeppelin jdbc parameters"

echo "Set the User, Password, and ConnectString parameters in the script as appropriate"
User=ssb
Password=ssb
ConnectString="localhost:1521/PDB1.gse00002281.oraclecloud.internal"
echo $ConnectString

cat <<EOF > /tmp/jdbc_settings.py
#!/usr/local/bin/python
#based on https://community.hortonworks.com/articles/36031/sample-code-to-automate-interacting-with-zeppelin.html by Ali Bajwa
def post_request(url, body):
  import json, urllib2
  encoded_body = json.dumps(body)
  req = urllib2.Request(str(url), encoded_body)
  req.get_method = lambda: 'PUT'
  try:
    response = urllib2.urlopen(req, encoded_body).read()
  except urllib2.HTTPError, error:
    print 'Exception: ' + error.read()
  jsonresp = json.loads(response.decode('utf-8'))
  print jsonresp['status']
        
 
 
import json, urllib2
zeppelin_int_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:9090/api/interpreter/setting/'
data = json.load(urllib2.urlopen(zeppelin_int_url))
for body in data['body']:
  if body['group'] == 'jdbc':
    jdbcbody = body
  elif body['group'] == 'spark':
    sparkbody = body    
    

 
jdbcbody['properties']['orcl-ssb.driver'] = 'oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver'
jdbcbody['properties']['orcl-ssb.user'] = '$User'
#jdbcbody['properties']['orcl-ssb.password'] = '$Password'  
#Zeppelin seems to be setting password to null, so leave it out
#so for now, put the password in the connect string
jdbcbody['properties']['orcl-ssb.url'] = 'jdbc:oracle:thin:$User/$Password@//$ConnectString'

post_request(zeppelin_int_url + jdbcbody['id'], jdbcbody)
EOF
#cat /tmp/jdbc_settings.py
echo ".."
python /tmp/jdbc_settings.py
echo "done"

paragraphs.title: Verify compression status and data in memory
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(orcl-ssb)
SELECT v.owner, v.segment_name,
v.bytes orig_size,
v.inmemory_size in_mem_size,
ROUND(v.bytes / v.inmemory_size, 2) comp_ratio
FROM v$im_segments v
ORDER BY 5;

paragraphs.title: Time a query with and without inmemory_query
paragraphs.text:
%sh
cat <<EOF > /tmp/mysql.sql
set echo on
set pages 999
set timing on
PROMPT run query with inmemory query enabled
SELECT d.d_year, c.c_nation, SUM(lo_revenue - lo_supplycost) profit FROM lineorder l, date_dim d,part p,
supplier s,customer c  
WHERE l.lo_orderdate = d.d_datekey
AND l.lo_partkey = p.p_partkey
AND l.lo_suppkey = s.s_suppkey
AND l.lo_custkey = c.c_custkey
AND s.s_region = 'AMERICA'
AND c.c_region = 'AMERICA'
GROUP BY d.d_year, c.c_nation
ORDER BY d.d_year, c.c_nation;
REM
REM
PROMPT run query with inmemory query disabled
alter session set inmemory_query=disable;
SELECT d.d_year, c.c_nation, SUM(lo_revenue - lo_supplycost) profit FROM lineorder l, date_dim d,part p,
supplier s,customer c  
WHERE l.lo_orderdate = d.d_datekey
AND l.lo_partkey = p.p_partkey
AND l.lo_suppkey = s.s_suppkey
AND l.lo_custkey = c.c_custkey
AND s.s_region = 'AMERICA'
AND c.c_region = 'AMERICA'
GROUP BY d.d_year, c.c_nation
ORDER BY d.d_year, c.c_nation;
exit;
EOF
# note use of \$ to escape $ from the shell

sqlplus ssb/ssb@PDB1 @/tmp/mysql.sql
